p: Sulpiride, an antipsychotic drug, is a selective dopamine receptor antagonist. It has high affinity to D2 and D4 receptors. It has been reported that sulpiride has an anti-inflammatory effect through increasing the intracellular cAMP level regardless the presence of dopamine signaling at D2 receptors (Brustolim et al., 2006). Based on this finding, it can be speculated that the drug can have a beneficial effect in the management of allergic rhinitis inflammatory manifestations. Sulpiride experiences a limited oral bioavailability not more than 27% due to its poor water solubility (Zidan et al., 2015).
